title: Psicóloga Aplicadora Aba
description:
O cargo de Piscóloga Aplicadora ABA deve executar com precisão os programas terapêuticos estabelecidos no currículo individualizado, a coleta de dados, além de participar das supervisões e garantir o bem-estar e buscar o engajamento do aprendiz, ser ativa nas resoluções de problemas junto a coordenação e ter uma prática de excelência nos atendimentos, ter domínio dos casos e da aplicação. Requisitos:
Com CRP ativo. Experiência com aplicação em análise do comportamento aplicada ao autismo. Abrir os programas estabelecidos no currículo. Conferência dos programas nas aplicações. Alinhamento junto com a coordenação as aplicações das ATS. Conferência de dados. Auxiliar na aplicação e orientação dos ATS e estagiários. Seguir o currículo elaborado pela coordenação. Realizar filmagens e/ou possíveis materiais (áudios ou imagens) solicitados pelo Supervisor e/ou coordenador. Registrar na folha de resumo pertinente e comunicar ao supervisor ou coordenador qualquer alteração no padrão comportamental do aprendiz e da família. Comunicar dúvidas e dificuldades na implementação dos procedimentos e programas estabelecidos no currículo durante a supervisão semanal. Participar de forma assídua e com pontualidade das supervisões, atendimentos e atividades definidas para a intervenção comportamental. #J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Coordenador (A) Transmissão - Administrativo
description:
Job descriptionSomos o Grupo Energisa! Com mais de cem anos de história, a Energisa é o maior grupo privado com controle 100% nacional do setor elétrico brasileiro. Nosso portfólio diversificado abrange distribuidoras, concessões de transmissão, geração de grande porte renovável, uma marca inovadora de soluções energéticas – a (re)energisa –, com geração distribuída por fonte renovável, comercialização de energia no mercado livre e serviços de valor agregado, além de uma central de serviços compartilhados, uma empresa de contact center e a fintech Voltz, a primeira do nosso setor no mercado de contas digitais. Recentemente, diversificamos nosso portfólio com a inclusão da distribuição de gás natural, através da aquisição da ES Gás. Transformamos, através de nossos mais de 17.000 colaboradores, energia em conforto e desenvolvimento para mais de 20 milhões de pessoas. Acreditamos na força da diversidade e da pluralidade para gerar inovação e atingir resultados incríveis. Aqui todos são muito bem-vindos! Quer fazer parte desta história? Confere se esta oportunidade tem match com o seu perfil e vem conosco participar desta jornada de seleção!Main responsibilitiesRealizar a gestão dos empreendimentos do plano estratégico da Companhia, assegurando o cumprimento do cronograma físico e financeiro, bem como, as exigências legais e contratuais, objetivando cumprimento de metas de prazo, custo, escopo e qualidade das obras e satisfação do cliente;
Diagnosticar, monitorare atualizar o avanço físico dos projetos frente ao programado, realizar o planejamento das atividades da área buscando a mitigação de causas, impacto das intercorrências contribuindo para o encaminhamento de soluções pertinentes;
Elaborar e gerenciar planos de ação para retomadas de metas e objetivos contratuais;
Identificar, analisar emitigar riscos inerentes aos empreendimentos, através das ferramentas de gerenciamento de projetos, analisando as contratações, planejamento das atividades em campo, energizações e unitização dos projetos, entre outros;
Gerenciar contratos de fornecimentos de bens e serviços, garantindo o atendimento de todas as exigências contratuais, acompanhando periodicamente os resultados financeiros e de execução do contrato;
Interagir com clientes,visando conhecer, encaminhar e responder todas as demandas do cliente, bem como, negociando pleitos e reivindicações do contrato;
Representar a empresa perante o cliente, participando de reuniões de coordenação, avaliar os resultados do contrato, bem como, para definir contramedidas e novas estratégias de ação quando necessário;
Contribuir com análisese sugestões para oportunidades de melhoria nas especificações técnicas das obras / empreendimentos;
Desenvolver reportes a alta administração da empresa, através da análise das causas, impacto e as ações a serem realizadas para a continuidade e entrega dos projetos conforme os parâmetros preestabelecidos nos contratos;
Oferecer suporte ao Site Manager e equipes de fiscalização para atendimento das atribuições da obra/ empreendimento;
Gerenciar as atividadesde engenharia e suprimentos nos contratos sob sua responsabilidade;
Requirements and skillsEnsino Superior completo:
Graduação em Administração de Empresas, Engenharia Elétrica, Produção e/ou áreas relacionadas;
Additional informationAs PESSOAS são nossa maior ENERGIA. Pensando em seu bem-estar, oferecemos um leque de benefícios. Da só uma conferida no que você terá:
- Vale alimentação ou Refeição para fazer as compras para sua casa ou comer no seu restaurante preferido;
- Plano de saúde e odontológico para você e sua família;
- Previdência privadapara sua reserva financeira e investimentos;
- Seguro de Vida, para dar mais tranquilidade a você e a quem você ama;
- Participação nos lucros, como incentivo pelo seu trabalho e resultados;
- Programas de qualidade de vida que garantem o bem-estar e promovem a saúde dos nossos colaboradores;
- Gympass que te dá acesso a mais de 18 mil academias no Brasil. Se você possui os pré requisitos da vaga, faça sua candidatura e fique atento nas dicas:
- Durante a jornada do processo de seleção, a comunicação será via e-mail ou por telefone. Certifique que seus dados estão atualizados e fique de olho na sua caixa de e-mail, sem esquecer da caixa de spam. Fique atento nas ligações, os nossos telefones corporativos possuem variação de DDD.
- Caso receba um feedback negativo, não desanime, fique atento a outras oportunidades.#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Gerente - Impostos Indiretos | Manager 2
description:
Job Description & SummaryNa PwC, nossos profissionais de serviços tributários se concentram em fornecer consultoria e orientação aos clientes sobre planejamento tributário, conformidade e estratégia. Esses profissionais ajudam as empresas a navegar por regulamentações tributárias complexas e otimizar suas posições tributárias.In indirect tax at PwC, you will focus value-added tax (VAT), goods and services tax (GST), sales tax and other indirect taxes. Your work will involve providing advice and guidance to clients on indirect tax planning, compliance, and strategy, helping businesses navigate complex indirect tax regulations and optimise their indirect tax positions.Experiência requerida:
Profissional experiente em Tributos Indiretos.Vivência com Gestão de pessoas e referência técnica.Necessário profundo conhecimento da legislação de ICMS/IPI e PIS/COFINS;
Atuação em consultoria tributária;
Atuação de projetos de suporte à auditoria (desejável);
Experiência em planejamento tributário, levantamento de créditos e obrigações acessórias;
Experiência com pedido de Regime Especial.Graduação:
Superior completo em Ciências Contábeis, Direito, Administração ou Economia.Inglês:
Avançado#LI-DNI#J-18808-Ljbffr

mesas de operação, especialistas, backoffice e marketing;
Ecossistema comsoluçõesem crédito, previdência, offshore e carteiras administradas;
Plano de carreira estruturado com possibilidade de Partnership;
Cultura de altaperformance, com liberdade, meritocracia e crescimento real.Venha crescer com o Wiser! Se você busca um novo patamar na sua trajetória profissional, fale com a gente.

A Ação da Cidadania é uma organização sem fins lucrativos, com mais de 30 anos de história, comprometida em promover a cidadania, reduzir desigualdades e combater a fome no Brasil. Mobilizamos sociedade, poder público e iniciativa privada para garantir o direito à alimentação saudável, suficiente e variada, respeitando a autonomia das comunidades e construindo, de forma coletiva, um país mais justo e igualitário.Responsabilidades:

Utilizar o sistema Nasajon para registro e controle das movimentações.Requisitos:

Experiência comrotinas contábeis e fiscais;

title: Senior Ux Designer
description:
Senior UX DesignerWe are seeking a skilled and craft-oriented Senior UX Designer to join our team. This is a unique opportunity to join the Otis Accelerator during a pivotal moment as a Senior UX Designer to make a significant impact across multiple products and platforms, enhancing the experience of over 1 million users. Your expertise in user-centered design and innovation will play a crucial role in shaping our products and driving user satisfaction.On a typical day you will:
You will drive the creation of exceptional user experiences by balancing user needs with business goals. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and stay updated on industry trends to deliver innovative design solutions. This role requires a proactive problem-solver committed to enhancing overall user experiences.What You Will Need to be Successful:
4 to 6 years of experience, with a robust understanding of user-centered design methodologies, design thinking and best practices.Experience in working on B2B and enterprise-level products and platforms.Ability to balance user, business and technology goals.Advocate for the user throughout the design and development process.Deep Experience in end-to-end design delivery, including conducting user research and usability testing to gather insights and inform design decisions.Develop user personas, journey maps, and mental models based on research findings.Ability to leverage data and analytics to inform design decisions and measure the success of design solutions.Create wireframes, prototypes, information architecture and other interaction designs artifacts.Lead by example in design craftsmanship, to achieve excellence in user-centered design practices, ensuring consistency and quality across all deliverables.Proficiency in industry standard design tools such as Figma and Figjam.Proven ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment to define and implement design solutions.Strong communication and presentation skills to articulate design decisions and collaborating with stakeholders.Current with industry trends, tools and technologies to deliver innovative solutions through enhanced design processes.A passion for creating exceptional user experiences and solving design problems.Required qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), or a related field.Proven ability through a strong portfolio showcasing a deep understanding of UX principles, processes, experience mapping, information architecture and interaction design.Experience in leading design thinking workshopsExcellent team collaboration, communication and cross-functional skills.Capability to handle various projects and adjust to shifting priorities.Deep Experience with user research methods, including surveys, interviews, and usability testing.A strong understanding of accessibility standards and how to design inclusive user experiences.Experience in designing for various platforms, including web, mobile, and desktop applications.Familiar with lean UX, agile and scrum processes.Knowledge in OOUX is a plus.Apply now!#BuildWhatNext

noções de elétrica industrial, NR-10.⸻Perfil Comportamental - Proatividade e senso de urgência.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Sobre a AvenueNa Avenue, estamos em uma missão de oferecer as melhores plataformas e experiências para nossos clientes. title: Eletricista
description:
Que bom que nos encontramos!Deixa a gente se apresentar…Somos a MRS, uma empresa de logística que há quase 30 anos, junto com 20% de toda carga que é exportada no Brasil, transporta um pouco do talento de milhares de pessoas. Levamos em cada vagão os sonhos, as expectativas e os resultados alcançados por muita gente. Sempre com a clareza de que não se pode chegar a nenhum destino sozinho.Por isso, queremos conhecer você, que tem potencial para seguir com a gente e trilhar sua carreira com destino ao aprendizado e muitas realizações.Vamos à nossa primeira parada?Conheça as principais atribuições e responsabilidades para esta oportunidade:

title: Consultor De Tecnologia
description:
Sobre a vaga:
Estamos em busca de um(a) profissional com perfil analítico e técnico para atuar com automação de processos utilizando a linguagem Python. A pessoa será responsável por desenvolver, implementar e manter rotinas de automação, além de realizar integrações entre sistemas utilizando APIs e troca de dados via JSON. Também será fundamental o uso de bibliotecas como Pandas para tratamento, cruzamento e análise de dados.Responsabilidades:
Desenvolver e manter processos automatizados com foco em eficiência e escalabilidade.Realizar integrações entre sistemas via APIs REST, utilizando requisições e manipulação de dados no formato JSON.Manipular, transformar e analisar grandes volumes de dados com a biblioteca Pandas.Criar rotinas de ETL (Extração, Transformação e Carga) automatizadas.Documentar processos, fluxos de automação e boas práticas de codificação.Trabalhar em parceria com áreas de negócio e tecnologia, entendendo necessidades e propondo soluções de automação.Requisitos:
Experiência prática com desenvolvimento em Python para automação de processos.Conhecimento e experiência com integração de sistemas via APIs REST e manipulação de dados em formato JSON.Domínio da biblioteca Pandas para análise, cruzamento e tratamento de dados.Familiaridade com outras bibliotecas como Requests, NumPy, Openpyxl e ferramentas de automação como Selenium, PyAutoGUI ou similares.Capacidade de entender processos de negócio e propor melhorias através de automação.Boa comunicação e trabalho em equipe. Diferenciais:
Experiência com versionamento de código (Git).Conhecimento e experiência em web scraping utilizando BeautifulSoup.Formação:
Ensino superior completo ou em andamento em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia, Análise de Sistemas ou áreas correlatas. Quais são os benefícios?Remuneração condizente com o mercadoVale-refeição/Vale-alimentação (Flash) – Valor diário 37,50Vale-transporte para os dias de jornada de trabalho presencial Plano de saúde e plano odontológico Programa C4 Life (suporte psicológico, financeiro, pet, jurídico e social);
TotalpassParceria com oSesc Educação continuadaBônus trimestrais e anual sobre a performance;
Treinamento técnico mensalPlataforma Applause (bonificações)Inscrições onlineEnviei seu currículo para o e-mail:

title: Business Development Associate
description:
Job Posting:
Junior Business Development Associate (Junior to mid-level)Company:
FortyGuardLocation:
Fully Remote (contract based on candidate’s location;
compliant with ADGM employment regulations)Position:
Full-TimeAbout FortyGuard:
FortyGuard is a leading climate-tech startup transforming urban heat intelligence with precise urban temperature data (2-meter accuracy) and advanced heat analytics through our TemperatureOS (tOS) platform. We empower enterprises, governments, and urban planners globally to effectively tackle urban heat challenges and build resilient urban systems and more productive commerce.Position Summary:
We are seeking resilient, adaptable, and ambitious Junior Business Development Associates to accelerate our growth, enhance client relationships, and actively contribute to our strategic business objectives. This role offers extensive collaboration across technical, product, and executive teams, internally and externally, requiring proactive outreach, strategic content creation, and dynamic engagement within a rapidly evolving startup.Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement targeted outreach campaigns via email marketing, CRM platforms, and lead-generation tools to drive significant user and client growth.Prepare persuasive, client-specific proposals, engaging presentations (including design elements), and accurate technical documentation.Continuously enhance website content, blogs, whitepapers, and marketing materials clearly highlighting FortyGuard’s market impact, innovation, the problem being solved, and our unique approach.Coordinate and facilitate client meetings, manage diligent follow-ups (including setting up automated systems and using AI tools), and comprehensively support client engagement activities related to the Dashboard, API enterprise integrations, and advisory roles.Identify, engage, and onboard new clients, conduct impactful product demonstrations, and ensure seamless client integration and satisfaction with our SaaS solutions.Contribute strategically to critical business documents, such as business plans, go-to-market strategies, investor pitches, and competition submissions. Actively seek international competitions and stage opportunities for FortyGuard’s visibility and growth.Engage proactively with company advisors to ensure strategic alignment and effective communication.Innovate and execute social media and digital marketing strategies to significantly boost brand visibility, public engagement, and user acquisition.Must-Have Qualifications:
Demonstrated experience in digital outreach, CRM, and effective lead generation.Entrepreneurial spirit and proactive approach to problem-solving (we can't insist enough on how important is this).Proficiency in proposal writing, impactful presentations (including design abilities using platforms such as KeyNote or Figma), and meticulous technical documentation.Outstanding organizational, multitasking, and communication skills.Excellent verbal and written communication capabilities.Expertise in digital marketing platforms and analytical tools.Success Metrics:
Achieve defined user acquisition and client onboarding targets.Measurably increase engagement through outreach and digital marketing initiatives.Successfully attain or exceed set business development milestones (with bonus incentives).Additional Information:
Fully remote with flexible working hours to accommodate company operations and strategic US market expansion (starting late mornings UAE time).Competitive compensation with clear performance-based bonuses.Clear pathways for career advancement in a high-growth climate-tech environment.Join FortyGuard, and play a pivotal role in pioneering sustainable solutions for resilient urban futures.

title: Técnico Segurança Do Trabalho
description:
Você quer participar da transformação do saneamento no Brasil? Buscamos pessoas que, assim como nós, têm vontade de ir além do básico para aplicar seus conhecimentos em um setor que está mudando a vida de milhões de brasileiros e brasileiras.Na BRK, respeito, diversidade e inclusão são valores inegociáveis! Atuamos para promover um ambiente positivo, inovador, ético, inclusivo, seguro e de respeito às pessoas.Se você sempre quis trabalhar com propósito, temos uma oportunidade que pode te interessar:
Responsabilidades:
Responsável por consolidar informações de Segurança do Trabalho e elaborar relatórios mensais de acompanhamento dos indicadores de área de segurança;
Realizar treinamentos de Segurança do Trabalho (procedimentos, normas, legislação etc) com funcionários próprios e terceirizados;
Implementar ações e programas de incentivo educação para atitudes preventivas no trabalho;
Atuar como disseminadordos programas de prevenção e conscientização, dar apoio a CIPA e SIPAT da Unidade;
Garantir a verificação dos documentos da Empresa e de Fornecedores, para atendimento a requisitos legais associados a Segurança do Trabalho, elaboração de relatórios específicos da área;
Realizar a gestão dos EPIs dentro da empresa, bem como a indicação técnica de equipamentos de proteção individual, coletiva, contra incêndio, sinalização de segurança etc;
Atuar nos projetos de modificação de layout e ergonomia no trabalho para garantir a segurança e qualidade das instalações;
Realizar investigações para identificação de causas de incidentes ou acidentes e cuidar de toda a gestão dos documentos associados (relatórios, evidencias, ações corretivas etc) junto ao sistema da empresa e em meio físico;
Realizar inspeções de Segurança em frentes de trabalho, instalações e equipamentos observando as condições de segurança no trabalho, visando eliminar riscos de acidentes e/ou condições inseguras. Sempre que necessário, sugerir modificações e adequações para melhoria do processo;
Assegurar o cumprimentodas metas da sua área de atuação, através do planejamento, acompanhamento e execução das atividades, atuar na correção dos desvios e informar superiores das ocorrências, bem como interagir com as demais áreas envolvidas para comunicar e resolver problemas;
Cumprir os procedimentos de QSSMA da empresa e participar de palestras e treinamentos sempre que convocado.Requisitos:
Necessário Experiência na função.Curso de Técnico de Segurança do TrabalhoRegistro profissional no Ministério do TrabalhoCNH BExcel intermediário O que oferecemos:
Assistência Médica, Assistência Odontológica, Vale Refeição e Alimentação, Seguro de Vida, Previdência Privada, Vale Transporte, Programa de Apoio Pessoal Viva Bem, Day Off, Licença Paternidade ou Maternidade estendida, Participação nos Lucros e Resultados.+ Algumas vantagens que você pode conhecer durante o processo.A BRK é uma das maiores empresas privadas de saneamento do país e está presente em 13 estados e mais de 100 municípios, beneficiando a vida de mais de 16 milhões de pessoas. Investimos e operamos sistemas de água e esgoto em 13 estados do Brasil, fornecendo um serviço que faz toda a diferença para a saúde e o bem-estar da população.A BRK e seus acionistas estão comprometidos com um modelo de gestão ESG (da sigla em inglês para Meio Ambiente, Social e Governança), incorporando esta estratégia à tomada de decisões da companhia e à prestação de serviços. A empresa tem também um compromisso com a Diversidade e a Inclusão, sendo signatária do Pacto Global da ONU e dos Princípios de Empoderamento das Mulheres da ONU (WEP’s).E vale lembrar que somos uma empresa certificada pelo Great Place to Work 2022 como um excelente ambiente de trabalho!VEM SER BRK!

title: Vendedor Interno
description:

Este papel é focado em realizar vendas internas, com responsabilidade por atender clientes, identificar suas necessidades e oferecer os melhores produtos e serviços. title: Personalized Internet Assessor - Wfh Portuguese Speaker
description:
Looking for a freelance opportunity where you can make an impact on technology from the comfort of your home? If you are dynamic, tech-savvy, and always online to learn more, this part-time, flexible project is the perfect fit for you!A Day in the Life of a Personalized Internet Assessor:
In this role, you’ll be analyzing and providing feedback on texts, pages, images, and other types of information for top search engines, using an online toolThrough reviewing and rating search results for relevance and quality, you’ll be helping to improve the overall user experience for millions of search engine users, including yourself.Join our team today and start putting your skills to work for one of the world's leading search engines.The estimated hourly earnings for this role are 5.00 USD per hour. Payment is based on completed tasks, with the potential for higher earnings based on productivity.TELUS Digital AI CommunityOur global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.Qualification pathNo previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.Basic RequirementsWorking as a freelancer with excellent communication skills in PortugueseBeing a resident in Brazil for the last 5 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in BrazilActive use of Gmail, Google+, and other forms of social media and experience in the use of web browsers to navigate and interact with a variety of contentDaily access to a broadband internet connection, a smartphone (Android 5.0, iOS 14 or higher), and a personal computer to work on.AssessmentIn order to be hired into the program, you’ll take a language assessment and an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Don’t worry, our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience!Equal OpportunityAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

title: Coordenador De Planejamento Comercial
description:
Coordenador de Planejamento Comercial – VarejoSe você tem visão estratégica, paixão por moda e performance, e quer liderar um time que transforma dados em resultado, vem com a gente!Estamos em busca de um(a) Coordenador(a) de Planejamento Comercial para atuar no varejo da Reserva (lojas físicas e e-commerce), sendo responsável por conectar inteligência de negócio, sortimento e operação, impulsionando a rentabilidade, o giro de estoque e a eficiência comercial.Quais serão seus desafios?- Liderar o planejamento comercial do canal Varejo, garantindo a execução do calendário promocional e institucional da marca.- Desenvolver e acompanhar planos de vendas, metas e projeções com base em performance (vendas, margem, giro, estoque etc.).- Gerir o estoque de forma estratégica, incluindo previsões de demanda, OTB e compras por categoria.- Atuar na precificação, margem e CMV.- Apoiar o planejamento de compras junto aos times de Produto, Merchandising e Compras.- Contribuir para o desenho da estratégia comercial de cada coleção e período (lançamentos, liquidações, datas-chave).- Estruturar processos, relatórios e dashboards, em parceria com BI.- Desenvolver talentos e formar sucessores.O que esperamos de você:
- Experiência consolidada em Planejamento Comercial no varejo de moda.- Domínio dos principais KPIs da área (markup, giro, cobertura, estoque).- Conhecimento sólido em metodologia OTB.- Excel avançado (obrigatório).- Ensino Superior completo em Administração, Economia, Engenharia, Moda ou áreas correlatas.- Desejável pós-graduação ou cursos em Moda ou Gestão.- Conhecimento em Power BI e SQL será um diferencial.Competências que fazem a diferença:
- Liderança inspiradora e voltada para resultados.- Perfil analítico e estratégico, com comportamento intraempreendedor.- Excelente relacionamento interpessoal e capacidade de articulação com áreas parceiras.- Maturidade, proatividade e foco no negócio.Se você quer fazer parte de uma marca com propósito, cultura forte e que acredita no poder das pessoas, essa vaga pode ser o seu lugar. Bora crescer junto?

title: Software Engineer - Fullstack
description:
We’re looking for a Fullstack Engineer to help scale our international growth through translations and guest experiences. You’ll work across the full development cycle — from design to launch — building and maintaining both frontend and backend features.What You’ll Do:
Build and support scalable web features (frontend + backend)Collaborate on design and feature planningReview code, manage tasks in Jira, and communicate progress clearlyWhat We’re Looking For:
Extensive years of experience building user-facing web appsProficient in Go (Golang), TypeScript, and GraphQLSolid backend knowledge (HTTP, databases, Kubernetes)Strong communication and self-management in agile environmentsTech Stack:
Go, TypeScript, GraphQL, REST, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, CI/CDReady to join us? Apply now to be considered and help shape our global guest experience!

title: Estagiário Em Planejamento
description:
Se você é estudante de Engenharia, Administração ou áreas correlatas, tem perfil organizado, gosta de acompanhar processos e buscar melhorias, essa vaga é para você! Buscamos alguém proativo, com atenção aos detalhes e interesse em entender o funcionamento de uma empresa focada em soluções industriais.Requisitos:
- Cursando Ensino Superior em Engenharia, Administração, Logística ou áreas afins- Boa capacidade analítica e raciocínio lógico- Conhecimentos básicos em Excel- Facilidade com ferramentas digitais e sistemas de controle- Organização, responsabilidade e vontade de aprender- Boa comunicação verbal e escritaAtividades:
- Apoiar no planejamento e controle de operações internas- Acompanhar cronogramas, prazos e indicadores da área técnica- Atualizar relatórios de acompanhamento e desempenho- Auxiliar no controle de estoque de materiais das soluções técnicas- Apoiar na organização da oficina e no mapeamento físico de componentes- Colaborar na implementação de melhorias nos processos de planejamento e organizaçãoDiferenciais:
- Conhecimento em Project ou ferramentas de visualização de tarefas- Noções básicas de ER- Experiência prévia em projetos de organização ou planejamentoBenefícios:
- Bolsa Estágio- Vale Transporte- Seguro de Vida

title: Test Automation Engineer (Python)
description:
Test Automation Engineer (Python)Are you looking for an opportunity to join a highly-regarded IT development firm?Well, look no further! WebCreek is currently seeking a skilled Software Developer with strong expertise in both manual and automated testing, particularly using Python and Selenium. This is a remote position in CST working hours, and the ideal candidate will have a proven track record of developing high-performance software and ensuring its quality through meticulous testing.What You'll DoCollaborate with the team to develop test automation solutions for various applications used on drilling rigs.Assist in enhancing testing processes by creating and maintaining automated test scripts and frameworks.Conduct manual testing when automation is not yet implemented or feasible, ensuring thorough and comprehensive testing coverage.Work closely with software developers and quality assurance teams to identify test requirements and improve testing efficiency.Design, execute, and maintain test cases, test plans, and test documentation to ensure accurate and consistent testing procedures.Analyze test results and collaborate with stakeholders to address issues, troubleshoot problems, and ensure software quality.What You Have4+ years of professional experience.Strong development skills:
Proven ability to write clean, efficient code.Experience in both manual testing and test automation.Extensive experience in Python programming, including type hinting and use of the built-in unittest framework.Proven experience consulting on and implementing XPath queries or CSS selectors within complex HTML/XML documents.Proficient with Git workflows, branching, merging, pull requests, rebasing, and familiar with platforms such as GitHub or GitLab.Experience with Selenium or Playwright, including best practices in the Page Object Model (POM).Proficient in testing and interacting with RESTful APIs, with a strong understanding of CRUD operations.Strong understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts, including inheritance and composition.Dynamic and adaptable to changing situations.Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working with PostgreSQL databases.Familiarity with OPC and MQTT protocols.Experience with microservices architecture, particularly using MQTT, ROS, and WebSocket protocols for efficient message queuing.Proficiency in both Windows and Linux environments.Experience with C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Angular, and .NET WinForms is a big plus.Rockwell Software:
Proficient with RSLogix Studio 5000 for PLC and HMI systems, with familiarity in Vantage Point and RSLinx.What You'll GainFull-time, remote position in a quickly growing company.Competitive salary with regular revisions.Fifteen (15) paid-off days per yearPaid Local holidaysHealth Care Expense Sponsorship Fitness Sponsorship Flexible work environment.International team with opportunities to work abroad. Who We AreWebCreek is a provider of world-class software development teams and technical staff augmentation. We serve many Fortune 500 companies and other leading organizations. We have operations in ten countries and over 25 years of experience delivering top-notch digital solutions to the companies that power our world.WebCreek is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.Find out more about our job opportunities:
/>//careers.Webcreek.Com/

title: Search Engine Optimization Specialist
description: REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE· SEO migrations - redirection mapping and implementation· Knowledge of technical SEO components (canonicalization, XML sitemaps, keyword cannibalization, robots.Txt, schema), investigating indexation and crawl errors, conducting site audits· Familiarity and applied experience with tools such as Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, SEMRush (other SEO tools like Ahrefs or Moz) and Google Analytics· Strong understanding of core SEO concepts such as crawlability, renderability, and indexability, links, keyword research and content· Implement on-page optimizations to enhance page/content relevance, meta tags and content for improved search engine performance· Understanding of front-end web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Schema Markup· Identify strategic opportunities to grow organic traffic across the business· Google Business profile optimization· Experience in hyperlocal SEO, including location business listing management across online directories· Experience doing technical SEO at scale· Experience working with (and analyzing) large amounts of data

title: Devops Engineer - Salesforce
description:
We are seeking a skilled DevOps Engineer to join our innovative team. The ideal candidate will have a robust understanding of migration, deployment, and change management within Salesforce environments. Job Description:
- Perform migration and deployment of developments from the QAS environment to UAT and, after validation, to PRD.- Execute demand deployments and manage pre- and post-deployment manual steps.- Conduct rollbacks for solutions with issues in the production environment.- Manage changes in UAT and PRD environments.- Create and manage Change Requests (RDMs).- Document procedures for changes in UAT and PRD environments.- Generate and update deployment documentation.- Maintain necessary documentation, such as knowledge base, chatbot, and Confluence.- Provide technical support for the deployment of new applications in UAT and PRD.- Train Service Desk and Key Users team on the changes made.- Provide support to the client for knowledge transfer during the transition process.Requirements:
- Proficiency in deployment and change management tools for Salesforce.- Knowledge in rollback and troubleshooting in production environments.- Experience with technical documentation and knowledge management.- Ability to manage changes and coordinate with different teams.- Capability to train and support internal and external teams.- Fluent English for communication with international teams and documentation.- Experience with CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) tools specific to Salesforce.- Knowledge of documentation tools like Confluence.- Excellent communication and collaboration skills.- Ability to work under pressure and solve problems quickly.- Previous experience in complex and dynamic IT environments.- Ability to adapt to new technologies and methodologies.Languages:
- English- PortugueseOSF Digital is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, where you can bring your whole self to work. Join an inclusive and passionate community of professionals who help bring about digital transformation for businesses around the world. At OSF Digital, we welcome all individuals and do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity and expression, race, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, or any other protected category in any of the jurisdictions in which we conduct business.

description:

- Arquitetar e desenvolver aplicações empresariais robustas e integradas ao Salesforce.
- Implementar soluções com suporte a funcionalidades offline para aplicações mobile.
- Garantir as melhores práticas de desenvolvimento:
SOLID, Clean Code e Clean Architecture.
- Participar ativamente em todo o ciclo de vida dos projetos — da concepção à entrega.
- Promover a evolução técnica dos times através de mentorias e code reviews.
- Garantir integração entre Salesforce e sistemas externos com APIs e eventos.REQUISITOS - Experiência sólida em desenvolvimento Salesforce (Apex, LWC, Triggers, Integrações).
- Experiência avançada em desenvolvimento iOS com Swift e Objective-C.
- Inglês fluente para atuação global.
- Domínio de SOLID, Clean Code e Design Patterns (GoF).
- Experiência com integrações (REST/SOAP/Event-driven).
- Vivência com aplicações que demandam suporte offline.
- Perfil de liderança técnica e visão de arquitetura.DIFERENCIAIS - Certificações Salesforce (Developer II, Architect, Commerce Cloud).
- Experiência com Commerce Cloud.
- Conhecimento em DevSecOps e práticas de CI/CD.
- Experiência com testes automatizados e TDD em Salesforce e iOS.- O que temos pra te oferecer?Mais do que um plano de carreira!A BRQ acredita que cada fera deve ser protagonista do seu crescimento, tendo autonomia para criar seu próprio plano de desenvolvimento profissional. description:
Há mais de 15 anos, a BairesDev é líder em projetos tecnológicos. Entregamos soluções inovadoras para gigantes como Google e Rolls-Royce e as startups mais inovadoras do Vale do Silício.Temos uma equipe diversa de mais de 4.000 profissionais formada pelo Top 1% dos talentos de tecnologia do mundo, trabalhando remotamente em cargos de impacto global.Ao se candidatar para este cargo, você está dando o primeiro passo em um processo que vai além do comum. Nosso objetivo é alinhar suas paixões, habilidades, e expectativas às nossas vagas, colocando você no caminho para desenvolver uma carreira de sucesso excepcional.Se você é um líder natural com experiência em mentoria, este trabalho é para você! ComoNode Team Lead em nossa equipe de desenvolvimento, sua missão será supervisionar tecnicamente uma equipe de desenvolvedores experientes de frontend e backend. Você trabalhará em uma equipe global de ritmo acelerado responsável por levar a inovação ao próximo nível. A inovação está no centro da estratégia da BairesDev.- Trabalhar com a equipe para determinar as necessidades da arquitetura técnica global.- Identificar os pontos de integração para sistemas de terceiros e existentes.- Validar que todas as escolhas técnicas irão integrar com a solução final e aderir aos contratos técnicos definidos para integração.Aqui está o que estamos procurando:
- 7+ anos de experiência em desenvolvimento Node.- Gerenciamento avançado de metodologias ágeis.- Conhecimento avançado em Design Patterns.- Conhecimento avançado em infraestrutura de TI.- Experiência com Segurança.- Experiência em desenvolvimento/integração com aplicações de larga escala.- Totalmente especializado nas áreas de desenvolvimento Backend e Frontend.- Forte experiência em revisões de codificação e gerenciamento de pipelines de CI/CD.- Conhecimento especializado dos benefícios/fraquezas dos requisitos de um cliente.- Conhecimento avançado das vantagens e desvantagens de escolher uma determinada tecnologia.- Forte experiência participando de reuniões com clientes, usuários e stakeholders.- Experiência liderando equipes, alocando tarefas, identificando riscos, tomando decisões, estimando tarefas, gerenciando conflitos e planejando.- Nível avançado de inglês.Como tornamos seu trabalho (e sua vida) mais fácil:
Modalidade 100% remota - trabalhe de qualquer lugar.Excelente remuneração em USD ou na sua moeda local, como preferir.Hardware para você trabalhar de casa.Horários flexíveis - faça seu próprio horário.Licença parental remunerada, férias, e feriados nacionais.Ambiente de trabalho inovador e multicultural.Colabore e aprenda com o Top 1% global dos talentos de cada área.Ambiente de apoio com mentoria, promoções, desenvolvimento de habilidades, e diversas oportunidades de crescimento.Junte-se a uma equipe global onde seus talentos excepcionais podem se destacar!#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Cloud Professional Services Manager
description:
Join or sign in to find your next jobJoin to apply for the Cloud Professional Services Manager role at Canonical2 days ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Cloud Professional Services Manager role at CanonicalGet AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.This is an opportunity to run a Professional Services team (also known as Field Engineering) team, helping customers understand and implement Canonical's open source solutions in public clouds and in their own data centers. We work across the entire spectrum of cloud offerings, from Ubuntu itself to virtualisation and private cloud, Kubernetes, and the implementation of sophisticated open source solutions such as MLops platforms, data platforms and more. We are rapidly expanding the range of open source solutions we offer and deliver to customers, as we move into new industries like telco, finance, health care and media we design and develop new open source solutions to meet their needs.We believe that Engineering Managers should be outstanding engineers themselves. They should feel completely at home troubleshooting technical issues and having technical presales conversations with customers. They should contribute to project delivery themselves, but know that the technical contributions they bring are far less significant than their ability to shape the whole team's direction, focus and delivery. We grow management skills and train engineers, who are interested in soft skills, to be managers.We believe that open source is just starting to transform the tech sector and enterprise compute. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of 'most software to most companies'. To deliver on that ambition, our engineers are carefully selected from the applicants across the globe. We select for brilliance and motivation to take open source to the next level. Our engineering managers help teams achieve more than they realised they could, and feel proud of the result.The role of a Cloud Professional Services Manager at CanonicalThe Field Engineering team is our team of cloud solutions architects at Canonical, working directly with our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. The portfolio of products includes on-premise cloud solutions such as Openstack, MicroCloud and Ceph, and solutions that could be deployed either on-premises or in public clouds such as Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Spark, PostgreSQL, etc. The team works hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. Managers and team members also take part in presales conversations to provide technical advice during the sales process.A Cloud Professional Services Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role. You are also expected to actively participate in technical presales to help our department achieve our quarterly goals.Location:
This role will be home based, managing a team in your time zone.What your day will look likeLead and develop a team of engineers, ranging from graduate to seniorWork remotely in a single major time zoneCoach, mentor, and offer career development feedbackIdentify and measure team health indicatorsImplement disciplined engineering processesRepresent your team and product to stakeholders, partners, and customersDevelop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practicesPlan and manage progress on agreed goals and projectsBe an active part of the leadership team, collaborating with other leadersWhat we are looking for in youKnowledge of cloud computing concepts & technologies, such as Kubernetes, Openstack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc.Practical knowledge of Linux and networkingExperience in technical presalesYou are a dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with peopleExcellent verbal and written communication skills in EnglishPassion and a track record of developing and growing peopleExperience in leading, coaching and mentoring engineersOrganised and able to ensure your team delivers timely, high quality resultsAn exceptional academic track record from high school and, preferably, university as wellWillingness to travel up to 40% of the time. Field Engineers attend internal company events, external tech events and customer meetings.Additional skills that you might also bringSecond language - Spanish or French preferredPython knowledgeExperience collaborating with external partnersExperience collaborating with several internal teams and providing stakeholder feedback for engineering roadmapsWhat we offer youWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in personPersonal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per yearAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveMaternity and paternity leaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and othersPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.Seniority levelSeniority levelMid-Senior levelEmployment typeEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionJob functionProject Management and Information TechnologyIndustriesSoftware DevelopmentReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at Canonical by 2xSenior Customer Success Manager (Podcasts)We’re unlocking community knowledge in a new way. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.We are hiring an Enterprise Customer Success Manager at CanonicalCustomer success is a new and strategic department at Canonical, with the objective of reducing risk and churn, facilitating the adoption of new products or services, and supporting expansion within existing accounts. Customer Success Managers (CSM) are responsible for developing trust with their assigned customers and providing them with the best possible experience navigating Canonical's vast offering. By clearly understanding their customers' objectives, the CSM can align expectations, suggest a large range of additional services or product capacity to increase loyalty, alleviate any pain points, and help draw and deliver on an appropriate collaboration roadmap.We are growing our Customer Success team to continue to offer thoughtful, smart, precise interactions across our product portfolio, from Ubuntu to open-source infrastructure and applications. To provide the appropriate level of focus for every customer, CSMs are specialized in one of the following segments:
Mass - SMEs or large businesses starting their journey with CanonicalFocus - Large companies with established ARRStep Growth - a selection of high-potential customersAll CSMs contribute to business support at the company level for all remaining, not-yet-assigned customers (Tech segment), including our Store customers.Location:

title: Representante De Desarrollo De Ventas
description:
Canonical es una empresa de software global, es la editora de Ubuntu y soluciones empresariales de código abierto para la nube, desarrolladores, IoT e IA. Ubuntu es la distribución de Linux de más rápido crecimiento y se ubica como el sistema operativo número uno en la nube.En asociación con Google, Amazon, IBM y Microsoft, Canonical ayuda a las empresas a ser más ágiles, productivas y a adoptar nuevas tecnologías más rápidamente. Ejemplos de éxito de los clientes incluyen IA, Blockchain, IoT, robótica avanzada y vehículos autónomos, donde Ubuntu es la plataforma de desarrollo preferida.El papel de un representante de desarrollo de ventas en CanonicalCanonical es rentable y está creciendo. Consideramos que nuestra organización de desarrollo de ventas es la mejor academia de ventas de tecnología del mercado y, como tal, seleccionamos candidatos excepcionales y ambiciosos para unirse a nuestro equipo. Disfrutarás de este papel si eres organizado, persistente, carismático y trabajador. Deberás estar interesado en la tecnología y sus implicaciones comerciales. En este puesto, colaborarás con un equipo regional de ventas y marketing, y tu objetivo principal es encontrar proyectos de clientes que se ajusten a nuestras líneas de productos y difundir el buen nombre de Canonical en múltiples industrias y geografías diferentes.Haz clic AQUÍ para ver a nuestro equipo SDR discutir su papel en CanonicalCómo será tu díaManejar las consultas entrantes de los clientes a través de correo electrónico, teléfono y chat.Ejecutar campañas salientes de ventas y marketing.Viajar a eventos y conferencias en todo el mundo, presentar en stands e impulsar oportunidades de marketing y ventas cara a cara.Colaborar entre múltiples equipos y partes interesadas de alto nivel para impulsar resultados.Trabajar directamente con marketing en campañas.Investigar información sobre clientes potenciales.Generar un pipeline de varios millonesIdentificar perspectivas y tendencias del mercado.Ayudar a definir los procesos y políticas del equipo.Servir de enlace con clientes nuevos y existentes, organizando y asistiendo a reuniones mientras mapea activamente cuentas para identificar nuevas oportunidades.Crear, actualizar, mantener y fomentar con precisión clientes potenciales en oportunidades globales.Lo que buscamos en tiExcelentes resultados académicos en la escuela y la universidad.Pasión por los negocios y la tecnología.Compromiso con el aprendizaje y la mejora continua:
curioso, flexible, científico.Resolución creativa de problemas y colaboración entre equipos.Habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita.Impulsado por resultados con un espíritu de superaciónPersistencia y perseveranciaQue te ofrecemosTu salario base dependerá de varios factores, incluida su ubicación geográfica, nivel de experiencia, conocimientos y habilidades. Además de los beneficios anteriores, ciertos roles también son elegibles para beneficios y recompensas adicionales, incluidas bonificaciones anuales e incentivos de ventas basados en los ingresos o la utilización. Nuestra filosofía de compensación es garantizar la equidad en toda nuestra fuerza laboral global.Además de un salario base competitivo, brindamos a todos los miembros del equipo beneficios adicionales que reflejan nuestros valores e ideales. Ten en cuenta que pueden aplicarse beneficios adicionales según el lugar de trabajo y, para obtener más información al respecto, consulte a su socio de talento.Presupuesto de aprendizaje y desarrollo personal de 2000 USD al año.Revisión anual de compensaciónRecompensas de reconocimientoVacaciones anualesLicencia parentalPrograma de asistencia al empleadoOportunidad de viajar a nuevas ubicaciones para conocer colegas en "sprints"Priority Pass para viajes y mejoras de viaje para eventos de empresa de larga distanciaCanonical es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidadesEstamos orgullosos de fomentar un lugar de trabajo libre de discriminación. La diversidad de experiencias, perspectivas y antecedentes crean un mejor ambiente de trabajo y mejores productos. Cualquiera que sea su identidad, le daremos a su solicitud una consideración justa.Assistente Comercial | SDR (431744) - REMOTE#J-18808-Ljbffr

description:

Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.We are hiring a System Software Engineer for Rust compiler, tooling, and ecosystemWe are building a new team to focus on the Rust programming language and its ecosystem on Ubuntu. They will deliver the best possible Rust runtime, developer experience and supporting tooling in Ubuntu. We are keen to ensure that the cutting edge of modern programming languages innovation is available to Ubuntu users, to lay the foundation for future inventions and open source communities.This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux systems, software architectures and Rust programming language. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company and make Ubuntu the best operating system to develop and run Rust applications in the cloud, in datacenters, in containers, directly on the operating system, and anywhere Ubuntu can run.The Ubuntu Foundations Team delivers the core Ubuntu system, the base for the entire Ubuntu family of products and services. Ubuntu strives to deliver the latest-best free software components, in an easy to use and highly reliable form. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer the industry.Part of the Ubuntu Foundations team, you will work on some of the most critical toolchains involved in the making of Ubuntu but also pillars of the modern software ecosystem. You will leverage your experience and passion in Rust to make Ubuntu the best platform to develop, distribute and consume software built with Rust. Applicants will be passionate about the future of Rust, of Ubuntu, mindful of the dynamics of the open-source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large but innovative organizations. Applicants will drive best in class integration in Ubuntu from desktop to cloud in a secure, reliable, performing, efficient and future-proof fashion.You will be discussing design with other team members and mentor less senior engineers and participate in code reviews and design reviews. You will also be working with other teams to ensure architecture decisions improve the overall performance and experience of Ubuntu. Your role as part of the Ubuntu Foundations team will have an impact on every aspect of Ubuntu from Desktop, Server, Ubuntu Core and also cloud images.Location:

description:

Join or sign in to find your next jobJoin to apply for the Cloud Field Engineering Manager role at Canonical3 days ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Cloud Field Engineering Manager role at CanonicalThis is an opportunity to run a field engineering team, helping customers understand and implement Canonical's open source solutions in public clouds and in their own data centers. We work across the entire spectrum of cloud offerings, from Ubuntu itself to virtualisation and private cloud, Kubernetes, and the implementation of sophisticated open source solutions such as MLops platforms, data platforms and more. We are rapidly expanding the range of open source solutions we offer and deliver to customers, as we move into new industries like telco, finance, health care and media we design and develop new open source solutions to meet their needs.We believe that Engineering Managers should be outstanding engineers themselves. They should feel completely at home troubleshooting technical issues and having technical presales conversations with customers. They should contribute to project delivery themselves, but know that the technical contributions they bring are far less significant than their ability to shape the whole team's direction, focus and delivery. We grow management skills and train engineers, who are interested in soft skills, to be managers.We believe that open source is just starting to transform the tech sector and enterprise compute. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of 'most software to most companies'. To deliver on that ambition, our engineers are carefully selected from the applicants across the globe. We select for brilliance and motivation to take open source to the next level. Our engineering managers help teams achieve more than they realised they could, and feel proud of the result.The role of a Cloud Field Engineering Manager at CanonicalThe Field Engineering team is our team of cloud solutions architects at Canonical, working directly with our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. The portfolio of products includes on-premise cloud solutions such as Openstack, MicroCloud and Ceph, and solutions that could be deployed either on-premises or in public clouds such as Kubernetes, Kubeflow, Spark, PostgreSQL, etc. The team works hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. Managers and team members also take part in presales conversations to provide technical advice during the sales process.A Cloud Field Engineering Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role. You are also expected to actively participate in technical presales to help our department achieve our quarterly goals.Location:
This role will be home based, managing a team in your time zone.What your day will look likeLead and develop a team of Field engineers, ranging from graduate to senior, in the areas of Presales and Professional ServicesSolve customer problems by promoting our technologies and being a trusted advisorWork remotely in a single major time zoneCoach, mentor, and offer career development feedbackIdentify and measure team health indicatorsImplement disciplined engineering processesRepresent your team and product to stakeholders, partners, and customersDevelop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practicesPlan and manage progress on agreed goals and projectsBe an active part of the leadership team, collaborating with other leadersWhat we are looking for in youKnowledge of cloud computing concepts & technologies, such as Kubernetes, Openstack, AWS, GCP, Azure, Ceph, etc.Practical knowledge of Linux and networkingExperience in technical presalesYou are a dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with peopleExcellent verbal and written communication skills in EnglishPassion and a track record of developing and growing peopleExperience in leading, coaching and mentoring engineersOrganised and able to ensure your team delivers timely, high quality resultsAn exceptional academic track record from high school and, preferably, university as wellWillingness to travel up to 40% of the time. Field Engineers attend internal company events, external tech events and customer meetings.Additional skills that you might also bringSecond language - Spanish or French preferredPython knowledgeExperience collaborating with external partnersExperience collaborating with several internal teams and providing stakeholder feedback for engineering roadmapsWhat we offer youWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in personPersonal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per yearAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveMaternity and paternity leaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and othersPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.Seniority levelSeniority levelMid-Senior levelEmployment typeEmployment typeFull-timeJob functionJob functionEngineering and Information TechnologyIndustriesSoftware DevelopmentReferrals increase your chances of interviewing at Canonical by 2xTechnical Manager - Automotive and IndustrialEmbedded Linux Field Engineering ManagerEngineering Manager - Public Cloud, Python, GolangEngineering Manager - Security Standards and HardeningLinux Engineering Manager - Optimisation for Latest HardwareEngineering Manager for IAM (Identity and Access Management)Engineering Manager, Ubuntu Server - Ubuntu ProWe’re unlocking community knowledge in a new way. title: Graduate Customer Success Manager
description:
Join or sign in to find your next jobJoin to apply for the Graduate Customer Success Manager role at Canonical3 days ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Graduate Customer Success Manager role at CanonicalGet AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.The role of a Customer Success Manager at CanonicalCustomer success is a new and strategic department at Canonical, with the objective to reduce risk and churn, facilitate the adoption of new products or services and support expansion within existing accounts. Customer Success Managers (CSM) are responsible for developing trust with their assigned customers and providing them with the best possible experience navigating Canonical's vast offering. Through a clear understanding of their customer's objectives, the CSM can activate a large range of internal and external capabilities to alleviate any pain point, align expectations, as well as help draw and deliver on an appropriate collaboration roadmap.We are growing our Customer Success team to continue offering thoughtful, smart, precise interactions across our product portfolio, from Ubuntu to open source infrastructure and applications.This role is a first step in the CSM organisation. Although you will primarily focus on the Tech segment, including the store customers, you will also have a portfolio assigned. Ubuntu is chosen by thousands of new users every month. Our responsibility is to ensure the best user experience for them through problem-solving, onboarding, enablement and value realisation all the way to success. Collaborating with other teams and participating in campaign efforts, you will connect with a diverse set of users of Canonical products and identify our future champions.Location:
This role will be based remotely worldwide.What your day will look likeA strong focus on supporting customers by finding solutions to ticket requests.Enrich documentation about problem solving, Q&A, onboarding materials.Drive campaigns targeting multiple customers through digital touch-points and activities.Identify high potential as well as high risk customers from newly onboarded users or customersOnboard new customers and introduce them to our products and support processes. Products include:
Ubuntu Pro, MAAS, Landscape, Openstack, Ceph, Kubernetes, data applications and many more.Collaborate with Sales and Support in developing and delivering engagement plans that fulfill the customer's objectives.Engage with your portfolio of customers to ensure risk identificationCollect feedback from customers and format them for review by the product teamWhat we are looking for in youCustomer-facing experienceAn empathetic individual with a natural drive to help othersPassion for technology, infrastructure and Ubuntu in particular is a mustExcellent presentation skillsStrong organisational skills, ability to structure and constantly update documentationA team player capable of interacting with all departments internallyAdditional skills that you might also bringWe at the Customer Success team strongly appreciate various languages! Therefore, if you possess proficiency (both written and spoken) in Japanese, Korean, Spanish, Portuguese, German, French, or Italian, alongside an excellent command of English, please inform us!What we offer youWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. title: Manager Americas - Customer Success
description:
Join or sign in to find your next jobJoin to apply for the Manager Americas - Customer Success role at Canonical4 days ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Manager Americas - Customer Success role at CanonicalCanonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.The company is founder led, profitable and growing.We are hiring a Customer Success Regional Team Manager.To support Canonical's growth, we are expanding our CSM team globally and recruiting leaders to help our team of Customer Success Managers across regions. We consider our Customer Success operations an exceptional tool to sustain revenue retention and growth, placing excellence in delivering outstanding customer services in the new technologies sector. As such, we are looking for exceptional candidates with proven track records in Customer Success and an obvious passion for new technologies. Ideally, you have been a Customer Success Manager at one point in your career and naturally evolved to a leading position.You will enjoy this role if you are organised, persistent, analytical, diplomatic, a listener, hard-working, and determined to grow your skills and teams. As a lead, you are to provide mentoring, coaching in post-sales account management and feedback to team members. You play a crucial role in proactively identifying areas of improvement and implementing process change, driving high-performing teams. You are comfortable dealing with ambiguity and quickly adapt to changes. You seek collaboration with other teams to enhance the overall customer experience. Your key responsibility is to analyze regional performance metrics, identify trends and opportunities for improvement, and implement changes to increase efficiency and achieve business objectives. You will work hand-in-hand with the Head of Customer Success.CSMs engage a diverse customer base and follow diverse CSM motions to provide the appropriate level of focus for every customer. The right candidate would adapt to this diversity and bring broad experience to the team.Location:
This is a globally remote roleThe role entails:
Strategic planning and analysis:
preparing communication plans, Team Meetings, and other messages shared in broader management forums, setting yourself and your team up for success. Regularly reviewing key performance indicators and metrics is your baseline. You develop strategies to enhance customer engagement, improve retention rates, drive upsells or cross-sells where appropriate, and ultimately increase customer success.Customer interactions and support to your team:
you resolve escalated customer issues requiring expertise or intervention. You work closely with your team members to ensure timely resolution.Team management:
you are passionate about guiding and supporting your team members, helping them navigate complex customer situations, improve their skills, and achieve their goals. You are ready for regular performance reviews with team members. While your help in identifying areas for improvement is key, you are asked to celebrate excellence, recognise your team's achievements, and set goals for individual growth within the team.Cross-functional collaboration:
collaboration with other departments, such as Sales, Marketing, Product development, and Support, is essential. This ensures alignment on customer needs, feedback sharing, and coordinated efforts to drive customer success. You establish trustworthy channels of communication across the board.Documentation and reporting:
you are allowed to be creative! While building content with your team and your manager, you also ensure the changes are well documented, instilling quality and attention to detail in all you do.What we are looking for in youExcellent academic results at school and universityBachelor's or equivalent degree in Business, Communication or STEMKnowledge and passion for Customer Success, revenue management and technology, experience in SaaS or software industriesTrack record of bringing exceptional Customer Success experience resultsCommitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientificCreative problem-solving and cross-team collaborationExperience growing and developing a CSM teamHands-on approach to using data to drive team activities and continuous improvementWillingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal eventsNice-to-have skillsWe at the Customer Success team strongly appreciate various languages! Therefore, if you possess proficiency (both written and spoken) in Japanese, Korean, Spanish, Portuguese, German, French, or Italian, alongside an excellent command of English, please inform us!What we offer youWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per yearAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveMaternity and paternity leaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and othersPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. title: Global Head Of Gsi Alliances
description:
Join or sign in to find your next jobJoin to apply for the Global Head of GSI Alliances role at Canonical19 hours ago Be among the first 25 applicantsJoin to apply for the Global Head of GSI Alliances role at CanonicalCanonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.The company is founder led, profitable and growing.We have created a new senior leadership role, Head of Global System Integrator (GSI) Alliances, to lead our business development and partnership with these important actors in the global technology sector. As the publisher of Ubuntu and the leading provider of open source to major technology firms globally, we are expanding into the enterprise market where GSIs provide significant operational and tactical capacity. We have had good success with GSIs that are delivering next-generation private cloud, container, and public cloud solutions built with Canonical Ubuntu, and are looking to expand our investment in these alliances.Reporting to the VP Global Alliances and Channels, the Global Head of GSI Alliances will lead a team of representatives and develop that strategic go-to-market strength for Canonical. You will work closely with GSI partners throughout their sales cycles and across their sales organizations to make Canonical their trusted partner to deliver opensource solutions at scale for their enterprise customers. In this role you will be responsible for ensuring that our solutions are used or embedded at the core of GSI digital transformation platforms.Our GSI team builds trusted relationships with partners at executive level, increases Canonical market share and attach rate, evangelizes the partnership and leads all business interactions from engineers to CxO level. The Global Head of GSI Alliances will own the strategy, sell-to, sell-through and sell-with motions with all GSI partners, as well as promotion of our GSI related activities - from campaigns, to strategic opportunities and GSI related events (including Canonical s yearly GSI executive summit).Location:
Our company largely works from home, this role can be based in the Americas or EMEA.The role entailsOwn and drive GSI partner strategy, forecast, bookings and revenues for CanonicalLead and evolve a team towards accelerated revenue growth with GSIBuild strategic relationships with partners at executive levelsGuide our offering from product management, to product marketing, and scale it through the support of our global sales organizationWhat we are looking for in you:
The successful GSI Alliance Sales Director will have :
Experience in alliance and indirect sales management rolesExperience in the GSI sectorDeep commercial experience encompassing revenue and marginsProven leadership and presentation skillsInsight into open source, Ubuntu and Canonical's competition and opportunitiesTrack record of data-driven decision-makingAn autonomous, disciplined, hands-on, get-it-done mentalityWhat we offer colleaguesWe consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance.
